translated: That which afflicts is that which causes suffering. That which is afflicted, the basis of affliction, and that which afflicts are all afflictions.

original: de la ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa zhes bya bas las kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa zhes bya bas las kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: The statement through the cessation of ignorance, the karmic forces cease indicates the absence of the afflictions of karma.

original: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba 'gag pa de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang / gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba 'gag pa de'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: The statement through the cessation of the karmic forces, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense-fields, contact, and sensation cease indicates the absence of the afflictions of retribution.

original: tshor ba 'gags pas srid pa dang len pa dang / srid pa 'gag pa de'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba 'gags pas srid pa dang len pa dang / srid pa 'gag pa de'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: The statement through the cessation of sensation, craving, grasping, and becoming cease indicates the absence of the afflictions of passion.

original: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba 'gag pa med pas na skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba 'gag pa med pas na skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: The statement through the cessation of becoming, birth, old age, and death cease indicates the absence of the afflictions of birth.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni sdug bsngal te /
translated: Affliction is suffering.

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa med pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal med pa'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa med pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal med pa'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the absence of affliction is shown to be the quality of the absence of suffering.

original: dbang du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams de rnams kyi dbang du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dbang du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams de rnams kyi dbang du gyur pa ste /
translated: Those who are under the control of the world are those who are under the control of the world.

original: rang nyid kyis 'jig rten pa dbang du gyur pa'am yid du 'ong bar gyur pa dang / yang na de rnams kyi sems dbang la bzhag pa'am dbang thob pas na dbang du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis 'jig rten pa dbang du gyur pa'am yid du 'ong bar gyur pa dang / yang na de rnams kyi sems dbang la bzhag pa'am dbang thob pas na dbang du gyur pa'o //
translated: They are under the control of the world because they are under the control of the world or because they are pleasing to the world, or because they have attained control over the minds of the world.

original: gang gi phyir dbang rnams ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang rnams ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The powers are fourfold:

original: rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / dbang po la dbang ba dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba dang / shes rab la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / dbang po la dbang ba dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba dang / shes rab la dbang ba'o //
translated: the power of supernatural knowledge, the power of the faculties, the power of concentration, and the power of wisdom.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul la dbang bas bcud kyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten thams cad de rnams kyi dbang du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul la dbang bas bcud kyi 'jig rten dang snod kyi 'jig rten thams cad de rnams kyi dbang du gyur pa'o //
translated: Among them, by the power of supernatural knowledge, the entire world of beings and the world of the environment come under their control.

original: dbang @5b po la dbang bas spyod lam nye bar zhi bas 'jig rten pa la de rnams yid du 'ong ba skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang @5b po la dbang bas spyod lam nye bar zhi bas 'jig rten pa la de rnams yid du 'ong ba skyes pa'o //
translated: By the power of the faculties, the world is pleased with them because their conduct is peaceful.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bas sems des dbang du bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bas sems des dbang du bzhag pa'o //
translated: By the power of concentration, the mind is brought under control by that concentration.

original: shes rab la dbang bas ni nyon mongs pa thams cad las dang rnam par smin pa rnams yang dag par chad pa'i phyir bcings pa las rnam par grol ba ltar yang dag par skyes pa de'i phyir dbang thob pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab la dbang bas ni nyon mongs pa thams cad las dang rnam par smin pa rnams yang dag par chad pa'i phyir bcings pa las rnam par grol ba ltar yang dag par skyes pa de'i phyir dbang thob pa'o //
translated: By the mastery of wisdom, he is perfectly born because he is liberated from bondage due to the complete severance of all afflictions and their karmic maturations.

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya bas ni sred pa'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad med par bstan to //
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya bas ni sred pa'i phyogs kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad med par bstan to //
translated: The phrase his mind is completely liberated indicates the absence of all the dharmas that are afflicted by the side of craving.

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya bas ni ma rig pa'i phyogs pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya bas ni ma rig pa'i phyogs pa med par bstan to //
translated: The phrase his wisdom is completely liberated indicates the absence of the side of ignorance.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang rnam par bral ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol bas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags dang rnam par bral ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol bas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba brjod do //
translated: Thus, because he is free from attachment, he is called one whose mind is completely liberated because his mind is liberated.

original: ma rig pa dang bral ba'i phyir shes rab rnam par grol bas shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang bral ba'i phyir shes rab rnam par grol bas shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is free from ignorance, he is called one whose wisdom is completely liberated because his wisdom is liberated.

original: de la srid pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas thob par bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa ni sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la srid pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas thob par bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa ni sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The concentration and meditative attainment that are to be attained by abandoning the disturbing emotions and subsidiary disturbing emotions of the side of existence are called ‚Äúliberation of mind.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas thob par bya ba'i dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi shes pa ni shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas thob par bya ba'i dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi shes pa ni shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The knowledge of the path of Arhatship that is to be attained by abandoning all disturbing emotions is called ‚Äúliberation by means of wisdom.‚Äù

original: de la sems rnam par grol ba thob pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: de la sems rnam par grol ba thob pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: In this regard, one is liberated from the obscurations of meditative attainment by attaining the liberation of mind.

original: shes rab rnam par grol ba thob pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnam par grol ba thob pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: One is liberated from the obscurations of disturbing emotions by attaining the liberation by means of wisdom.

original: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dag ni sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dag ni sems shin tu rnam par grol ba dang shes rab shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Those who are liberated from both aspects are called ‚Äúthose whose minds are completely liberated‚Äù and ‚Äúthose whose wisdom is completely liberated.‚Äù

original: cang shes pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: cang shes pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThose who know everything‚Äù are fearless.

original: 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir mdo las cang shes pa lnga gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir mdo las cang shes pa lnga gsungs te /
translated: Five kinds of ‚Äúknowledgeable ones‚Äù are mentioned in the scriptures because they are fearless.

original: lce 'bab pa la sogs pa'i bag tsha ba 'byung bar dogs pa med pas khyu mchog cang shes dang / 'thab mo'i 'jigs pa med pas glang po che dang rta cang shes dag go //
analyzed: lce 'bab pa la sogs pa'i bag tsha ba 'byung bar dogs pa med pas khyu mchog cang shes dang / 'thab mo'i 'jigs pa med pas glang po che dang rta cang shes dag go //
translated: The bull is a ‚Äúknowledgeable one‚Äù because it is fearless in the face of danger, such as a lightning storm. The elephant and the horse are ‚Äúknowledgeable ones‚Äù because they are fearless in the face of the danger of battle.

original: gzhan gyis gnod par byed pa'i 'jigs pa med pas seng ge cang shes dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa'i dogs pa med pas dgra bcom pa yang cang shes zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod par byed pa'i 'jigs pa med pas seng ge cang shes dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa'i dogs pa med pas dgra bcom pa yang cang shes zhes brjod do //
translated: The lion is a ‚Äúknowledgeable one‚Äù because it is fearless in the face of the danger of being harmed by others. The arhat is called a ‚Äúknowledgeable one‚Äù because it is fearless in the face of the danger of suffering.

original: mdor na bag tsha ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdor na bag tsha ba rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, there are four kinds of fear:

original: sdug bsngal gyis bag tsha ba dang / 'jigs pas bag tsha ba @6a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis bag tsha ba dang / 'jigs pas bag tsha ba @6a * //
translated: fear of suffering, fear of danger,

original: dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tsha ba dang / mi shes pas bag tsha ba'o //
analyzed: dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tsha ba dang / mi shes pas bag tsha ba'o //
translated: fear of worldly things, and fear of ignorance.

original: bag tsha ba 'di rnams med pa'i phyir rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bde ba thob pa dang / mi skrag pa thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob pa dang / dbugs phyung ba thob pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bag tsha ba 'di rnams med pa'i phyir rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bde ba thob pa dang / mi skrag pa thob pa dang / mi 'jigs pa thob pa dang / dbugs phyung ba thob pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Because of the absence of these fears, respectively, one obtains happiness, obtains fearlessness, obtains fearlessness, and obtains relief.

original: de la mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba rnams med pa'i phyir dang mya ngan med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyis bag tsha ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de la mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba rnams med pa'i phyir dang mya ngan med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyis bag tsha ba med pa'o //
translated: There is no fear of suffering because there is no sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and perturbation, and because there is no sorrow.

original: bdag gis smad pa dang / gzhan gyis smad pa dang / ngan 'gro dang 'tsho ba med pa dang chad pas bcad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang / 'chi bas 'jigs pa rnams med pa'i phyir 'jigs pas bag tsha ba rnams med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis smad pa dang / gzhan gyis smad pa dang / ngan 'gro dang 'tsho ba med pa dang chad pas bcad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pa dang / 'chi bas 'jigs pa rnams med pa'i phyir 'jigs pas bag tsha ba rnams med pa'o //
translated: There is no fear of terror because there is no self-condemnation, no condemnation by others, no fear of unhappy states of existence, no fear of the loss of livelihood, no fear of punishment, no fear of not being able to speak, and no fear of death.

original: rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa dang grags pa dang ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang smad pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis gos pa med pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tsha ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa dang grags pa dang ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang smad pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis gos pa med pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tsha ba med pa'o //
translated: He is not afraid of the worldly dharmas, because he is not stained by gain and loss, fame and disgrace, praise and blame, pleasure and pain.

original: rang gi lam shes pa la bar du gcod par gyur pa'i mi shes pa dang the tshom gyi shes pa dang log pa'i shes pa rnams med pa'i phyir mi shes pas bag tsha ba med do //
analyzed: rang gi lam shes pa la bar du gcod par gyur pa'i mi shes pa dang the tshom gyi shes pa dang log pa'i shes pa rnams med pa'i phyir mi shes pas bag tsha ba med do //
translated: He is not afraid of ignorance, because he has no ignorance, doubt, or wrong understanding that would obstruct his knowledge of his own path.

original: de lta bas na bag tsha ba med pa'i phyir cang shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bag tsha ba med pa'i phyir cang shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the one who is fearless because he is not afraid.

original: glang po chen po zhes bya ba ni gtso bo chen po rnams zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: glang po chen po zhes bya ba ni gtso bo chen po rnams zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The great elephant means the great leaders.

original: kha cig ni rig pa gsum dang ldan pa /
analyzed: kha cig ni rig pa gsum dang ldan pa /
translated: Some have the three knowledges,

original: kha cig ni so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: kha cig ni so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: some have attained the analytical knowledges,

original: kha cig ni mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa /
analyzed: kha cig ni mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa /
translated: some have the six superknowledges,

original: kha cig ni shes pa brda sprod pa'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i rtogs pa'i chos brnyes pa'i phyir glang po chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni shes pa brda sprod pa'i chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i rtogs pa'i chos brnyes pa'i phyir glang po chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Some are called great elephants because they have attained the Dharma of realization which is superior, being called the Dharma of communicating knowledge.

original: bya ba byas pa byed pa byas pa zhes bya bas ni bsgrubs pa yongs su rdzogs pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa byed pa byas pa zhes bya bas ni bsgrubs pa yongs su rdzogs pa nyid bstan te /
translated: The phrase, ‚Äúhaving done what had to be done, having accomplished what had to be accomplished‚Äù indicates the completion of the task.

original: 'di lta ste tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yongs su rdzogs pas sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par thar pa ni bya ba ste ci nas kyang bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yongs su rdzogs pas sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par thar pa ni bya ba ste ci nas kyang bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The task is the complete liberation from all suffering, which is accomplished by the completion of morality, concentration, and wisdom.

original: 'dod pa chung bas 'tsho ba dang / chog shes pas 'tsho ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yan lag gis 'tsho ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar byed pas 'tsho ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung bas 'tsho ba dang / chog shes pas 'tsho ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yan lag gis 'tsho ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar byed pas 'tsho ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byed pa ste /
translated: The phrase, ‚Äúhaving a livelihood that is free from desire, having a livelihood that is content, having a livelihood that is pure, having a livelihood that is pleasing‚Äù indicates the activity.

original: rang dga' ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir de yongs su rdzogs pas go rims ji lta bar bya ba byas @6b pa dang byed pa byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang dga' ba dang 'brel ba'i phyir de yongs su rdzogs pas go rims ji lta bar bya ba byas @6b pa dang byed pa byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is related to one's own delight, it is called the completion of the task and the performance of the task, respectively.

original: khur bor ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khur bor ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the laying down of the burden,

original: khur ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: khur ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: the burden is of four kinds:

original: phung po'i khur dang / nyon mongs pa'i khur dang / dam bcas pa'i khur dang / brtson 'grus kyi khur rnams te /
analyzed: phung po'i khur dang / nyon mongs pa'i khur dang / dam bcas pa'i khur dang / brtson 'grus kyi khur rnams te /
translated: the burden of the aggregates, the burden of the defilements, the burden of vows, and the burden of striving.

original: yongs su gtang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir go rims ji lta bar 'di rnams kyi bor ba ni yongs su gtong ba dang / spong ba dang /üîΩsgrub par byed pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gtang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / spang bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir go rims ji lta bar 'di rnams kyi bor ba ni yongs su gtong ba dang / spong ba dang /üîΩsgrub par byed pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The laying down of these burdens is their laying down in the sense of their being given up, in the sense of their being abandoned, in the sense of their being accomplished, and in the sense of their being completed, respectively.

original: de rnams kyang sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spangs pa dang / lam bsgoms pa dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyang sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spangs pa dang / lam bsgoms pa dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pas so //
translated: And they are due to the complete understanding of suffering, the abandonment of origination, the cultivation of the path, and the realization of cessation.

original: de rnams bor bas ni lhag ma med pa'i bde ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i bde ba dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba gang zhig thob pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams bor bas ni lhag ma med pa'i bde ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i bde ba dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba gang zhig thob pa'o //
translated: And by abandoning them, one attains the bliss of no remainder, the bliss of liberation, the bliss of perfect enlightenment, and the bliss of complete peace.

original: de'i phyir khur bor ba nyid kyis khur bor ba'i bde ba thob pa'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir khur bor ba nyid kyis khur bor ba'i bde ba thob pa'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: Thus, by the very abandonment of the burden, the quality of attaining the bliss of abandoning the burden is taught.

original: rang gi don rjes su thob pa zhes bya ba la rang gi don thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rang gi don rjes su thob pa zhes bya ba la rang gi don thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Having attained one's own goal, one's own goal is attained in two ways:

original: don ma yin pa spangs pa dang / don thob pa'o //
analyzed: don ma yin pa spangs pa dang / don thob pa'o //
translated: the abandonment of what is not the goal and the attainment of the goal.

original: gang zhig ma rig pa spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa gang yin pa de ni don ma yin pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ma rig pa spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa gang yin pa de ni don ma yin pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of what is not the goal is the abandonment of all afflictive obstructions due to the abandonment of ignorance.

original: gang zhig rig pa skyes pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs pa 'di ni don thob pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rig pa skyes pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa rtogs pa 'di ni don thob pa'o //
translated: The realization of nirvana through the arising of knowledge is the attainment of the goal.

original: srid par kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid par kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The complete destruction of the fetters that bind one to existence.

original: srid pa skye bar byed pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams ni srid pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams te srid pa dang lhan cig tu skyes bu la kun tu sbyor bar byed pa ni 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa skye bar byed pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams ni srid pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams te srid pa dang lhan cig tu skyes bu la kun tu sbyor bar byed pa ni 'ching ba'o //
translated: The fetters that cause existence, the fetters that bind one to existence, are the fetters that arise together with existence. They bind the person to existence, and so they are fetters.

original: de bas na srid par kun tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na srid par kun tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: Thus, they are the fetters that bind one to existence.

original: de rnams kyang rnam pa dgu yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang rnam pa dgu yin te /
translated: They are also of nine types.

original: lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba zhes bya ba gsum ni zag pa med pa'i yang dag pa'i lta bas spong ba yin no //
analyzed: lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba zhes bya ba gsum ni zag pa med pa'i yang dag pa'i lta bas spong ba yin no //
translated: The three fetters called the fetter of views, the fetter of holding a discipline and ritual as paramount, and the fetter of doubt are abandoned by the uncontaminated correct view.

original: phrag dog gi kun tu sbyor ba dang / ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / khong khro'i kun tu sbyor ba zhes bya ba gsum dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags la kun tu sbyor ba'i phyogs gcig 'dod pa'i khams kyi phyogs su gtogs pas zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir 'di rnams spong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phrag dog gi kun tu sbyor ba dang / ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba dang / khong khro'i kun tu sbyor ba zhes bya ba gsum dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags la kun tu sbyor ba'i phyogs gcig 'dod pa'i khams kyi phyogs su gtogs pas zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir 'di rnams spong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: and one part of the fetter of attachment to existence, which is included in the desire realm, are abandoned by attaining the uncontaminated meditative absorption.

original: nga rgyal gyi kun @7a * //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi kun @7a * //
translated: The fetter of pride,

original: ji lta yin zhe na /

translated: Because at one time the BhagavƒÅn, in one setting, taught the miracles of samƒÅdhi and magical power to just one assembly, and then taught the perfection of wisdom.

original: skye ba yang ma yin te gang gi phyir tha snyad la rung ba nyid byed pa'i don du brda'i ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan rnams 'di ni 'di'i ming can no zhes phyis rnam par gzhag par byed de /

translated: The five aggregates have the nature of the distinction between the apprehended object and the apprehending subject. The apprehended object does not exist, because the characteristic of the apprehended object is not tenable.

original: de bas na ri bong gi rva dang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i sems can la ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' nyid do /

analyzed: de med pas de dang snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo yang gzhan dbang rnams la mi bden pa'i snang ba tsam nyid kyis med pa'i phyir lhag ma yongs su grub pa'i ngo bos de rnams kyis 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Since that does not exist, the dependent natures that are the entities of the appearances and the consciousnesses of that do not exist, because they are mere false appearances. The remaining nature, the thoroughly established nature, is their reality.

original: ca'a  phyir zhe na /

translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir ma dmigs pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma dmigs pas so //
translated: Because it is not perceived.

original: dpyad pa la yod pa na mi rtog cing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpyad pa la yod pa na mi rtog cing yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When there is analysis, the non-conceptual and non-perception is by the non-conceptual wisdom of profound meditative equipoise.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma 'tshal zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' bzhin du 'thad pa rnams so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma 'tshal zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' bzhin du 'thad pa rnams so //
translated: The statement I do not understand the perfection of wisdom is reasonable like the bodhisattvas.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni 'ga' yang ma yin te rigs pas mthong ba la gnod par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni 'ga' yang ma yin te rigs pas mthong ba la gnod par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement no one means that no one at all sees it through reasoning, because it is contradicted.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni gang la yang ma yin te byang chub sems nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni gang la yang ma yin te byang chub sems nyid bzhin no //
translated: The statement in anything means that it is not in anything at all, like the nature of bodhicitta.

original: shes pa'i phyir te rtogs pa'i don du brjod pa ni gdams pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i phyir te rtogs pa'i don du brjod pa ni gdams pa'o //
translated: The statement for the sake of knowing means for the sake of realizing. The statement instruction means instruction.

original: rjes su bstan pa'i rtogs pa la rjes su mthun pa rnams kyi bya ba nyid kyis lung la bar du gcod par byed pa dor par bya ba nyid kyi man ngag go //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa'i rtogs pa la rjes su mthun pa rnams kyi bya ba nyid kyis lung la bar du gcod par byed pa dor par bya ba nyid kyi man ngag go //
translated: The statement guidance means guidance. The statement realization means realization. The statement in accordance with means in accordance with. The statement to be done means to be done. The statement hindrance means hindrance. The statement should be abandoned means should be abandoned.

original: de bas na don dam pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dag la mthong ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don dam pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dag la mthong ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom and the bodhisattvas are not seen by way of the ultimate.

original: de'i phyir gdams pa med pa zhes shes nas gal te mi smra bar gyur na de'i tshe sems can gyi don spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gdams pa med pa zhes shes nas gal te mi smra bar gyur na de'i tshe sems can gyi don spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, knowing that there is no instruction, if one remains silent, then the welfare of sentient beings will be abandoned.

original: de bas na sems can yongs su smin pa la sogs pa'i don du thabs la mkhas pas yongs su brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kho na bzung bar byas nas kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis sems can rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gdams ngag bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sems can yongs su smin pa la sogs pa'i don du thabs la mkhas pas yongs su brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kho na bzung bar byas nas kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis sems can rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gdams ngag bya'o //
translated: Therefore, for the sake of ripening sentient beings and so on, having taken up only the defining characteristics that are thoroughly investigated by skillful means, one should give the instruction in the perfection of wisdom to sentient beings by way of the conventional.

original: gzhan du na sems can gyi don nyams pa chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can gyi don nyams pa chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be a great loss of the welfare of sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir 'di rnams chos thams cad kyi don dam pa stong pa nyid nye bar srid pa'i kun gal te bstan par ma gyur na de'i tshe shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di rnams chos thams cad kyi don dam pa stong pa nyid nye bar srid pa'i kun gal te bstan par ma gyur na de'i tshe shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because if the ultimate emptiness of all phenomena were not taught to them, they would not understand.

original: ma shes pa ni sgom par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma shes pa ni sgom par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not understand, one does not meditate.

original: ma bsgoms pas ni mngon du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bsgoms pas ni mngon du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not meditate, one does not realize.

original: de bas na sems can rnams la thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa las skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang /
analyzed: de bas na sems can rnams la thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa las skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang /
translated: Therefore, sentient beings are born with the ignorance that is beginningless, and they are born with all the afflictions, the causes of the lower realms, bad destinies, birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation,

original: sdug bsngal ba @23a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba @23a * //
translated: pain,

original: dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa'i rgyu'i dngos po 'dzin pa de'i gnas skabs can la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa'i rgyu'i dngos po 'dzin pa de'i gnas skabs can la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: and mental anguish. They are born with the causes of all of these.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad ni tha snyad tsam ste don dam par na stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa zhes ci nas kyang kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad ni tha snyad tsam ste don dam par na stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa zhes ci nas kyang kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis bstan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are mere conventions. They are of one taste with emptiness in the ultimate. One should teach this in every way, using the methods of the conventional.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gdams ngag rnams la don dam par mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gdams ngag rnams la don dam par mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom and the instructions of the bodhisattvas are impossible in the ultimate.

original: nye bar rdzogs pa'i kun rdzob kyis bstan par mdzad pa na chos thams cad kyi mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba nges par bstan par 'byung ba'i gdams ngag bdag gis bstan zhes 'phags pa rab 'byor gyi dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar rdzogs pa'i kun rdzob kyis bstan par mdzad pa na chos thams cad kyi mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba nges par bstan par 'byung ba'i gdams ngag bdag gis bstan zhes 'phags pa rab 'byor gyi dgongs pa'o //
translated: When the teaching of the conventional that is fully accomplished is made, the instruction that arises from the teaching of the application of the non-apprehension of all phenomena is the intention of the noble Subh≈´ti, ‚ÄúI will teach.‚Äù

original: da ni gdams ngag 'di'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni gdams ngag 'di'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to teach the result of this instruction, he says:

original: 'on kyang yang gal te de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang yang gal te de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBut if, on the other hand, it is said that‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te de zhes bya ba mi zad pa gzhan gal te'i don la'o //
analyzed: gal te de zhes bya ba mi zad pa gzhan gal te'i don la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is said that‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúif‚Äù in the sense of another imperishable.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni don dam par gdams ngag med pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni don dam par gdams ngag med pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù is in the sense of the absence of instruction in the ultimate.

original: smras pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa da ltar byung ba dang nye ba yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba'i dus la la ta'o //
analyzed: smras pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa da ltar byung ba dang nye ba yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba'i dus la la ta'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSaid‚Äù and so on is the present and the near, and so ‚Äúarisen‚Äù is the present tense.

original: smras pa dang zhes bya ba ni smras pa'i don la'o //
analyzed: smras pa dang zhes bya ba ni smras pa'i don la'o //
translated: The phrase having spoken means having spoken the meaning.

original: bstan pa dang zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi mtshan nyid la'o //
analyzed: bstan pa dang zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi mtshan nyid la'o //
translated: The phrase having taught means having taught the wisdom that has the nature of hearing.

original: nye bar bstan pa la zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi mtshan nyid la'o //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa la zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi mtshan nyid la'o //
translated: The phrase having fully explained means having taught the wisdom that has the nature of contemplation.

original: mngon par phyogs par byas nas zhes bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: mngon par phyogs par byas nas zhes bya ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: The phrase having directed is a variant reading.

original: gang gi phyir 'di thams cad mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni shes rab mngon par 'phel ba dang dad pa mngon par 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di thams cad mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ni shes rab mngon par 'phel ba dang dad pa mngon par 'phel ba'o //
translated: The result of the practice of nonapprehension is the increase of wisdom and the increase of faith.

original: shes rab mngon par 'phel bas sems kyi bskum pa med pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab mngon par 'phel bas sems kyi bskum pa med pa'o //
translated: The increase of wisdom is the absence of mental contraction.

original: dad pa mngon par 'phel bas skrag pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa mngon par 'phel bas skrag pa la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The increase of faith is the absence of fear, etc.

original: shes rab de yang gnas gsum la lhag pa yin te zab mo bstan pa dang shin tu sdug bsngal bar byed par bsgrub pa dang shin tu yang ngo mtshar ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la'o //
analyzed: shes rab de yang gnas gsum la lhag pa yin te zab mo bstan pa dang shin tu sdug bsngal bar byed par bsgrub pa dang shin tu yang ngo mtshar ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la'o //
translated: Moreover, that wisdom is superior in three situations: in the teaching of the profound, in the accomplishment of what is extremely difficult to do, and in the extremely amazing qualities of a Buddha.

original: 'di rnams mdo las 'byung ba'i zab mo'i gnas rnams la ye shes kyis byas pa'i sems bskum pa skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams mdo las 'byung ba'i zab mo'i gnas rnams la ye shes kyis byas pa'i sems bskum pa skye ba ma yin no //
translated: In these situations, one does not become discouraged by the profundity of the subject matter as it occurs in the scriptures.

original: gnas gsum po 'di rnams la ma dad par byas pas skrag pa skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas gsum po 'di rnams la ma dad par byas pas skrag pa skye ba ma yin no //
translated: One does not become frightened by these three situations, having lost faith in them.

original: thog mar skye ba'i dus su sems kyi bskum ba ni 'god pa ste bar ma'i gnas skabs la kun @23b tu zhum pa'o //
analyzed: thog mar skye ba'i dus su sems kyi bskum ba ni 'god pa ste bar ma'i gnas skabs la kun @23b tu zhum pa'o //
translated: At the beginning, when one is just starting out, one is discouraged, but in the middle one is completely discouraged.

original: chen po'i gnas skabs la bag tsha ba'o //
analyzed: chen po'i gnas skabs la bag tsha ba'o //
translated: In the end, one is apprehensive.

original: rnam pa gang gis rtog pa la yang der sems kyi mngon par mi dga' ba ni yid phyir phyogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis rtog pa la yang der sems kyi mngon par mi dga' ba ni yid phyir phyogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By whatever aspect one conceives of them, one is not pleased in one's mind, and one turns away from them.

original: slar yang gang du bcom zhing phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lhag par 'don pa yin te /
analyzed: slar yang gang du bcom zhing phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lhag par 'don pa yin te /
translated: Again, not crushed and not turned away is the additional reading.

original: der chen po ni bag 'khums pa rgyun du gnas pa'i bag la bums pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: der chen po ni bag 'khums pa rgyun du gnas pa'i bag la bums pa thob pa'o //
translated: There, the great one is the one who has attained the state of being constantly crushed by the latent impressions of the latent tendencies.

original: mngon par mi dga' ba la rgyun du gnas pa ni bcom zhing phyir phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par mi dga' ba la rgyun du gnas pa ni bcom zhing phyir phyogs pa'o //
translated: Constantly abiding in non-delight is crushed and turned away.

original: de ltar gnas ma yin pa la byas pa dang dad pa med pa dang chud du dang 'bring dang chen po'i gnas skabs gsum sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnas ma yin pa la byas pa dang dad pa med pa dang chud du dang 'bring dang chen po'i gnas skabs gsum sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the three states of small, medium, and great should be applied to the non-basis, lack of faith, and waste.

original: de ltar gdams ngag gi 'bras bu nye bar bstan nas mjug bsdu bar byed pas gsungs pa 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gdams ngag gi 'bras bu nye bar bstan nas mjug bsdu bar byed pas gsungs pa 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having thus taught the result of the instruction, to conclude he says this very... and so on.

original: 'di nyid ni don dam pa'i chos thams cad mi dmigs pa la sems bskum pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni don dam pa'i chos thams cad mi dmigs pa la sems bskum pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: This very [instruction] is the ultimate non-observation of all phenomena, free from the mind being crushed and so on.

original: de nyid 'di'i gdams ngag ste zhes 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste 'di nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab bo //
analyzed: de nyid 'di'i gdams ngag ste zhes 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa ste 'di nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab bo //
translated: Some editions read that itself is the instruction for this. This perfection of wisdom is called the wisdom that has the characteristic of not observing any phenomena.

original: 'di ni gdams pa ste gang zhig de dag las yang dag par rab tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gdams pa ste gang zhig de dag las yang dag par rab tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the instruction, which is the correct application in those [phenomena].

original: de ltar gnas na zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa 'di nyid la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnas na zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa 'di nyid la gnas pa yin no //
translated: If one abides in that, one abides in just this non-observation of all phenomena.

original: de nyid 'di'i gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa lags so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid 'di'i gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa lags so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That itself is the instruction and teaching for this.

original: aa ni'i rkyen ni ao na la sogs pas 'byung ste /
analyzed: aa ni'i rkyen ni ao na la sogs pas 'byung ste /
translated: The suffix i is formed with the case ending o and so on.

original: dh'a ri ni bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dh'a ri ni bzhin du'o //
translated: It is like dhƒÅri.

original: de ltar na dang po nges par 'byung ba'i gdams ngag yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar na dang po nges par 'byung ba'i gdams ngag yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Thus, having completed the first, the instruction on renunciation,

original: gnyis pa nges par 'byung ba'i phan yon gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa nges par 'byung ba'i phan yon gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the second, the benefits of renunciation, is stated beginning with Moreover.

original: chen po rnams la phan yon rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa yin te yongs su shes par bya ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la yongs su shes pa dang / spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams la spang ba dang /
analyzed: chen po rnams la phan yon rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa yin te yongs su shes par bya ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la yongs su shes pa dang / spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams la spang ba dang /
translated: The four benefits for the great beings are stated: the thorough knowledge of the phenomena such as form that are to be thoroughly known, the abandonment of the attachments, hatreds, etc. that are to be abandoned,

original: yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams la yongs su rdzogs pa dang / mngon du bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa rnams la so sor dmigs pa mngon du byed pa'o //üîΩde la dmigs @24a * //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams la yongs su rdzogs pa dang / mngon du bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa rnams la so sor dmigs pa mngon du byed pa'o // de la dmigs @24a * //
translated: the thorough completion of the perfections, etc. that are to be thoroughly completed, and the realization of the concentrations, etc. that are to be realized.

original: pa'i lta ba 'di rnams la med de phan yon rnam la grub ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa'i lta ba 'di rnams la med de phan yon rnam la grub ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: These views that have those as objects do not exist, and so the benefits are established.

original: chos thams cad la rlom sems su mi bgyid pa bshad nas ji srid du byang chub kyi sems la yang rlom sems su mi bgyid pa der gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad la rlom sems su mi bgyid pa bshad nas ji srid du byang chub kyi sems la yang rlom sems su mi bgyid pa der gsungs so //
translated: After explaining that one should not imagine any phenomena, it is said that one should not imagine even the thought of enlightenment.

original: 'dir ni bstan pa la bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi sems la byang chub sems dpa' shin tu rlom sems kyi yul la rlom sems su mi byed pa gsungs pa de nyid kyis chos thams cad la rlom sems su mi byed pa grub pa yin no
analyzed: 'dir ni bstan pa la bsdus pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi sems la byang chub sems dpa' shin tu rlom sems kyi yul la rlom sems su mi byed pa gsungs pa de nyid kyis chos thams cad la rlom sems su mi byed pa grub pa yin no
translated: Here, since it is included in the teaching, the statement that the bodhisattva does not falsely project anything onto the thought of awakening establishes that he does not falsely project anything onto all phenomena.

original: // des kyang yongs su shes par bya ba rnams la yongs su shes pa dang spang bar bya ba rnams la spangs pa dang yongs su rdzogs par bya ba rnams la yongs su rdzogs pa dang mngon du bya ba phan yon don las grub pa yin no //
analyzed: // des kyang yongs su shes par bya ba rnams la yongs su shes pa dang spang bar bya ba rnams la spangs pa dang yongs su rdzogs par bya ba rnams la yongs su rdzogs pa dang mngon du bya ba phan yon don las grub pa yin no //
translated: By that, he knows what is to be known, abandons what is to be abandoned, perfects what is to be perfected, and realizes what is to be realized. The benefit is established from the meaning.

original: zhes gtso bor byang chub kyi sems la rlom sems su mi byed pa nyid gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes gtso bor byang chub kyi sems la rlom sems su mi byed pa nyid gsungs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, the statement that he does not falsely project anything onto the thought of awakening is the main point. The phrase and also is used because it is a further instruction.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i gdams ngag la ltos nas gzhan yang gi tshig ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i gdams ngag la ltos nas gzhan yang gi tshig ste /
translated: The phrase and also is used in relation to the instruction on emancipation.

original: spyod cing zhes bya bas lam gyi dus su spyod pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: spyod cing zhes bya bas lam gyi dus su spyod pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase practicing indicates that it is practiced at the time of the path.

original: bsgoms pas zhes bya ba ni so sor rtogs pa'i dus su yang dag par 'byung ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms pas zhes bya ba ni so sor rtogs pa'i dus su yang dag par 'byung ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: By cultivating means that it is taught to arise in the time of discernment.

original: de ltar bslab par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni rlom sems su mi byed pa nyid kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //üîΩci ltar byang chub kyi sems des kyang rlom sems su mi bgyid do des kyang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dmigs nas gang zhig 'jug pa'i sems ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba gang zhig dang ldan pa'i phyir sems can yang byang
analyzed: de ltar bslab par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni rlom sems su mi byed pa nyid kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o // ci ltar byang chub kyi sems des kyang rlom sems su mi bgyid do des kyang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la dmigs nas gang zhig 'jug pa'i sems ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba gang zhig dang ldan pa'i phyir sems can yang byang
translated: Thus should train means that one should train in that way by not conceiving of anything.

original: chub sems dpa' zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chub sems dpa' zhes brjod do //
translated: How is it that one should not conceive of even the thought of enlightenment? By that means that one should not conceive of even the thought of enlightenment by observing the bodhisattvas, since it is the thought that engages in that.

original: yang gi sgra ni khyad par gyi don du'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni khyad par gyi don du'o //
translated: The word even has the sense of a distinction.

original: gang gi phyir de sems can thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yin te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yang 'dod pa des kyang rlom sems su bya ba ma yin na chos gzhan rnams kyis lta yang ci smos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de sems can thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yin te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yang 'dod pa des kyang rlom sems su bya ba ma yin na chos gzhan rnams kyis lta yang ci smos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is superior to all sentient beings.  Even with that desire, the bodhisattvas should not become proud, much less with other dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ste de ni de'i rlom sems su mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ste de ni de'i rlom sems su mi byed pa'o //
translated: Why is that?  That is, he does not become proud.

original: rnam pa gang gis so //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis so //

translated: Moreover, one should understand that the object of the afflictions in the continuum of another is called ‚Äúthe opposite,‚Äù otherwise, one would speak of the absence of afflictions in those who abide in the absence of afflictions.

original: 'di ni nyan thos kyi theg pas nyon mongs pa med pa la bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos kyi theg pas nyon mongs pa med pa la bshad pa'o //
translated: Here, the absence of afflictions is explained in terms of the vehicle of the hearers.

original: 'dir ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi spros pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi spros pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: Here, the elaborations of all conceptual thoughts are the afflictions.

original: de rnams med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i snyoms par zhugs pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i snyoms par zhugs pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: Because they do not exist, the meditative equipoise free from conceptual thought is the absence of afflictions.

original: des gnas pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa zhes brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: des gnas pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa zhes brjod pa yin la /
translated: Because one abides in that, it is called ‚Äúabiding in the absence of afflictions.‚Äù

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

original: gang zhig sems can rnams ma nges pa'i rigs can dbang po rtul bo de rnams de bzhin gshegs pas ma spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i yul yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi spyod pa la skal ba dang mi ldan par mkhyen nas thog mar dgra bcom pa @26b nyid
analyzed: gang zhig sems can rnams ma nges pa'i rigs can dbang po rtul bo de rnams de bzhin gshegs pas ma spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i yul yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi spyod pa la skal ba dang mi ldan par mkhyen nas thog mar dgra bcom pa @26b nyid
translated: The TathƒÅgata knows that those sentient beings of unfixed potential who have dull faculties are not fit for the conduct of true enlightenment, the object of the afflictions that he has not abandoned.

original: la gnas par byed do //
analyzed: la gnas par byed do //
translated: So he first causes them to abide in the state of an arhat.

original: de nas de rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa bstan par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas de rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa bstan par byed pa yin te /
translated: Then he teaches them the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: des de rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yongs su rdzogs par rung ba'i bsam pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: des de rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yongs su rdzogs par rung ba'i bsam pa 'byung ste /
translated: By that, the thought of being fit for the complete bodhisattva deeds arises in them.

original: de nas rim gyis zab mo'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rim gyis zab mo'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, gradually, they attain the acceptance of the profound Dharma.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi sa la nges pa'i bsam ba can so sor rab tu phye ba'i chos kyi dbyings zab mo'i chos la bzod pa so sor thob pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas nyid kyi phyir lung bstan par mdzad de /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi sa la nges pa'i bsam ba can so sor rab tu phye ba'i chos kyi dbyings zab mo'i chos la bzod pa so sor thob pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas nyid kyi phyir lung bstan par mdzad de /
translated: Thus, the Tathagata gives predictions of full enlightenment to those who have the attitude of certainty about the Buddha ground, who have attained the acceptance of the profound Dharma of the ultimate expanse, which is differentiated in each moment.

original: de rnams kyi sa dang por mthong ba'i lam nyid la sa brgyad pa la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sa dang por mthong ba'i lam nyid la sa brgyad pa la gnas pa yin no //
translated: On the first of those grounds, the path of seeing, they are on the eighth level.

original: ji ltar nyan thos kyi theg pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa mthong ba'i lam nyid la phyir mi 'ong ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos kyi theg pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags spangs pa mthong ba'i lam nyid la phyir mi 'ong ba yin te /
translated: Just as in the Sravakayana, one who has abandoned attachment to the desire realm by means of a path that is outside the Great Vehicle is a nonreturner on the path of seeing.

original: de ltar na yang 'phags pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po las /
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'phags pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po las /
translated: In the Sublime Sutra of the White Lotus of the Sacred Dharma, it says:

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la lung bstan pa sa brgyad pa la gnas pa lhun gyis grub ba rnam par mi rtog pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po gnas brtan te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la lung bstan pa sa brgyad pa la gnas pa lhun gyis grub ba rnam par mi rtog pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po gnas brtan te /
translated: The one who is predicted to perfect enlightenment is a great bodhisattva, a steadfast one, who is on the eighth level, spontaneously present and nonconceptual.

original: de nas nyon mongs pa'i yul mi skyed par byed pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa'i nyan thos rnams las mchog yin te /
analyzed: de nas nyon mongs pa'i yul mi skyed par byed pa nyid kyis nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa'i nyan thos rnams las mchog yin te /
translated: Then, by not generating the objects of affliction, they are supreme among the ≈õrƒÅvakas who abide in the absence of affliction.

original: de ltar na yang sems med pa nyid kyis bshad pa la gnas brtan ni nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa'i mchog tu gsungs pa ltar brtan pa zhes bya ba'i bsngags pa rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang sems med pa nyid kyis bshad pa la gnas brtan ni nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa'i mchog tu gsungs pa ltar brtan pa zhes bya ba'i bsngags pa rigs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, just as the elder is said to be supreme among those who abide in the absence of affliction, it is reasonable to praise him as ‚Äústeadfast‚Äù in the explanation of the absence of mind.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yul skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis gtso bo la 'ga' zhig yang dgos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yul skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis gtso bo la 'ga' zhig yang dgos pa ma yin no //
translated: By not generating the objects of affliction, there is no need for any other principal [factor].

original: da ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus legs so zhes bya ba dang bsngags pa la sogs pas mngon par bstod pa nyid brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can phan yon nye bar bstan par byed de /
analyzed: da ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus legs so zhes bya ba dang bsngags pa la sogs pas mngon par bstod pa nyid brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid can phan yon nye bar bstan par byed de /
translated: Now, the elder ≈öƒÅriputra, by praising and so forth, teaches the benefits characterized by irreversibility for the bodhisattva endowed with diligence.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyir mi ldog par nye bar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyir mi ldog par nye bar brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should be considered irreversible, etc.

original: phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyis nye bar 'dzin par bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyis nye bar 'dzin par bya'o //
translated: One should be considered as irreversible.

original: sa rab tu dga' ba'i ming can sems bskyed pa dang po la brten nas stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i don du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'das nas phyir @27aüîΩ* // mi ldog par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba'i ming can sems bskyed pa dang po la brten nas stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i don du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la 'das nas phyir @27a * // mi ldog par 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: On the first generation of the thought, which is the stage called Joyful, one should be considered irreversible, having passed beyond the stages of the Disciples and the Self-Buddhas, in order to realize the nature of all dharmas which is emptiness, wishlessness, and signlessness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar yang chos thams cad rlom sems su mi byed pa'i rang bzhin gyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar yang chos thams cad rlom sems su mi byed pa'i rang bzhin gyis rig par bya'o //
translated: And one should know that one is not separated from the perfection of wisdom, and that one does not falsely project any dharma, because of the nature of dharmas.

original: da ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bslab pa thams cad la yang phan pa nyid brtan par byed de /
analyzed: da ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bslab pa thams cad la yang phan pa nyid brtan par byed de /
translated: Now, in order to firmly establish the benefit of the perfection of wisdom for all the trainings in the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and perfect enlightenment,

original: nyan thos kyi sa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste nyan thos kyi byang chub byed pa po'i chos rnams la sgom pa ni nyan thos kyi sa'am yul yang rung ba ni sa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste nyan thos kyi byang chub byed pa po'i chos rnams la sgom pa ni nyan thos kyi sa'am yul yang rung ba ni sa'o //
translated: it says ‚Äúthe ≈õrƒÅvaka level‚Äù and so on. The cultivation of the qualities that bring about the enlightenment of the ≈õrƒÅvakas is the ≈õrƒÅvaka level or domain.

original: gang gi rten gyis de rnams la ye shes de bskyed par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi rten gyis de rnams la ye shes de bskyed par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the basis on which the knowledge of those is generated.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi sa'o //
translated: Similarly, the buddha level.

original: 'dir yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la theg pa gsum la mkhas pa bskyed pa'i don du bslab pa ste slar nges par 'byung ba'i don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la theg pa gsum la mkhas pa bskyed pa'i don du bslab pa ste slar nges par 'byung ba'i don du ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the training is for the purpose of generating expertise in the three vehicles for the bodhisattvas, but not for the purpose of definite emergence.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gtso bo ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gtso bo ste /
translated: These bodhisattvas are the principal ones.

original: de ltar na yang nyan thos kyi theg pa la slob par 'dod pas sems dpa' chen pos shes rab chen po rnams las 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang nyan thos kyi theg pa la slob par 'dod pas sems dpa' chen pos shes rab chen po rnams las 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who wishes to train in the vehicle of the disciples should study the great wisdom.

original: mnyan par bya ba ni gzhung las so //üîΩgzung bar bya ba ni zlos par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba ni gzhung las so // gzung bar bya ba ni zlos par bya ba'o //
translated: One should listen to it from the scriptures.üîΩ One should retain it by reciting it.

original: bcang bar bya zhes bya ba ni snying la gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcang bar bya zhes bya ba ni snying la gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: One should keep it by keeping it in mind.

original: bklag par bya zhes bya ba ni mi brjed pa'i don du gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: bklag par bya zhes bya ba ni mi brjed pa'i don du gdon par bya'o //
translated: One should read it by reciting it in order not to forget it.

original: kun chub par bya zhes bya ba ni don las so //
analyzed: kun chub par bya zhes bya ba ni don las so //
translated: One should master it by its meaning.

original: rnam pa thams cad du shes par bya kun nas zlos par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du shes par bya kun nas zlos par bya ste /
translated: One should recite it in every way,

original: gzhan rnams la yang gzhung dang don dag bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la yang gzhung dang don dag bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and also explain the text and its meaning to others.

original: gzhan rnams rjes su 'dzin pa ni de rnams la yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pas 'jug pa dang yongs su smin pa dang rnam par grol ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams rjes su 'dzin pa ni de rnams la yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pas 'jug pa dang yongs su smin pa dang rnam par grol ba'i don du'o //
translated: The care for others is for the sake of their engagement, maturation, and liberation, by perfecting the accumulations of merit and direct intuition.

original: 'ga' zhig tu rab tu 'don par bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //üîΩbslab par bya zhes bya ba ni bslab pa la nges par 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu rab tu 'don par bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no // bslab par bya zhes bya ba ni bslab pa la nges par 'byung bas so //
translated: In some places, it is said, ‚Äúone should recite.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúOne should train‚Äù means one should attain liberation through training.

original: rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa dang so sor rtog pa'i nges par 'byung ba dag gis so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa dang so sor rtog pa'i nges par 'byung ba dag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should practice‚Äù means one should attain liberation through investigation and discernment.üîΩPractice is ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

original: rnal 'byor ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong de bya'o //
translated: One should practice that.

original: dus dang dngos po dang lam dang 'gro bar bya ba zhes bya bas rnal 'byor gyi las nyid de 'on kyang rab tu grags pa'i las kyis las nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po la rkyen @27b no //
analyzed: dus dang dngos po dang lam dang 'gro bar bya ba zhes bya bas rnal 'byor gyi las nyid de 'on kyang rab tu grags pa'i las kyis las nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po la rkyen @27b no //
translated: The practice of yoga is through time, things, the path, and what is to be traversed. However, it is not a practice due to the well-known activity, but rather a thing due to the condition.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la yang zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa ni bcu ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la yang zhes bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sa ni bcu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOn the bodhisattva grounds‚Äù means the grounds of the bodhisattvas are ten.

original: rab tu dga' ba dang ji srid chos kyi sprin no //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba dang ji srid chos kyi sprin no //
translated: They are the Joyous, up to the Cloud of Dharma.

original: de nyid ni lam shes pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni lam shes pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: That itself is called the knowledge of the path.

original: thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la thabs ni rgyu rnams so //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba la thabs ni rgyu rnams so //
translated: Endowed with skill in means refers to the means, which are the causes.

original: de rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: And those are the perfections of generosity, etc., in order to perfect the qualities of a buddha, in order to ripen beings, and in order to quickly attain complete enlightenment.

original: de la mkhas pa ni rno ba ste ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa ni rno ba ste ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
translated: Skill in those is sharpness, which is the correct practice.

original: de yang rgyas par rnam pa mang ba ste de dang der gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rgyas par rnam pa mang ba ste de dang der gsungs pa'o //
translated: That is extensive, with many varieties, as it is taught here and there.

original: mdor bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi shes pas yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi shes pas yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
translated: The concise is that all the bodhisattva qualities are purified by conventional knowledge.

original: phyis don dam par mi dmigs pas rnam par sbyong bar byed pa de bas na shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa yang yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyis don dam par mi dmigs pas rnam par sbyong bar byed pa de bas na shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa yang yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Later, by not observing the ultimate, he purifies. Therefore, it is very complete and very pure.

original: de 'dir thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ste des yang dag par ldan pa ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir thabs la mkhas pa zhes bya ste des yang dag par ldan pa ni ldan pa'o //
translated: This is called skill in means here. Endowed with that, he is endowed.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thon par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su bsgrub pa'i don du rnal 'byor thams cad kyi ni nges so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thon par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su bsgrub pa'i don du rnal 'byor thams cad kyi ni nges so //
translated: For the sake of attaining all the Buddha dharmas means for the sake of accomplishing the Buddha dharmas in the bodhisattvas, all yogas are definite.

original: 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams ni rgyas par gsungs pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'di la gal pa med de 'ga' zhig tu byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'dir ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams ni rgyas par gsungs pa zhes bya ba 'dis 'di la gal pa med de 'ga' zhig tu byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Here, it is said that the bodhisattva dharmas are extensive. By this, there is no need for this, because in some places it is said for the sake of attaining all the bodhisattva dharmas.

original: bla na med pa yang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: The unexcelled, perfect enlightenment, etc. The supramundane intuition that is included in the diamond-like concentration of the Buddhas is the perfect enlightenment.

original: de la slob pa ni gang zhig sa bcu thob nas sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa'i don du sbyor ba'i yam la goms pa'o //
analyzed: de la slob pa ni gang zhig sa bcu thob nas sangs rgyas kyi sa thob pa'i don du sbyor ba'i yam la goms pa'o //
translated: The learner is one who, having attained the ten stages, is engaged in the practice for the attainment of the stage of Buddhahood.

original: de nyid ni yang dag pa'i byang chub ste sbyar ba'i lam dang bcas pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni yang dag pa'i byang chub ste sbyar ba'i lam dang bcas pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: That itself is the perfect enlightenment, the knowledge of all modes together with the path of preparation.

original: de ltar 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos @28a * //
analyzed: de ltar 'dis ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid las ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos @28a * //
translated: Thus, it is from this perfection of wisdom itself that the Bodhisattva, the great being, should seek the knowledge of all modes.

original: gang la bslab par bya ba dang rnal 'byor du bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rgyas par bstan to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis yul gyis nges par 'byung ba'i phan yon bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la bslab par bya ba dang rnal 'byor du bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rgyas par bstan to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis yul gyis nges par 'byung ba'i phan yon bstan pa yin no //
translated: The benefits of renunciation are indicated by the passage up to: ‚Äúall the qualities of the Buddha are extensively taught, which are to be trained in and practiced.‚Äù

original: da ni nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ji tsam gyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: da ni nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa ji tsam gyis yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the extent of the aspects of renunciation?

original: nges par 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba bstan par bya ba ni de yang nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba bstan par bya ba ni de yang nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The presentation of the divisions of renunciation is that there are six types of practice of renunciation:

original: mtha' gnyis la khas mi len pa'i sgrub pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i sgrub pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i sgrub pa dang / nye bar gdags pa'i sgrub pa dang / rigs pa'i sgrub pa dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis la khas mi len pa'i sgrub pa dang / gnas pa med pa'i sgrub pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i sgrub pa dang / nye bar gdags pa'i sgrub pa dang / rigs pa'i sgrub pa dang / myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: the practice of not accepting the two extremes, the practice of non-abiding, the practice of non-grasping, the practice of designation, the practice of reasoning, and the practice called ‚Äúrapid full enlightenment.‚Äù

original: gang zhig bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes pa ni gcig tu na chos gzhan ma yin te byang chub sems dpa' yang ma 'tshal la 'on kyang ming tsam ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyis ma 'tshal zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: gang zhig bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes pa ni gcig tu na chos gzhan ma yin te byang chub sems dpa' yang ma 'tshal la 'on kyang ming tsam ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyis ma 'tshal zhes bya ba'i
translated: However, the mere name is not apprehended by the bodhisattva himself.

original: khyad par gsungs pa ni 'dis ni rnam pa bzhi bstan par byed de byang chub sems dpa' dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag ma 'tshal ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gi
analyzed: khyad par gsungs pa ni 'dis ni rnam pa bzhi bstan par byed de byang chub sems dpa' dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag ma 'tshal ma dmigs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung gi

original: gang zag gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la nges par sbyar bar bgyi zhes bya gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang zag gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang la nges par sbyar bar bgyi zhes bya gsungs pa /

original: de ltar gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis nges par 'byung ba'i rab tu dbye ba brjod pa'i phyir sngar gsungs pa'i chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can nges @28b par 'byung ba'i gdams ngag brjod pa gnas skabs nye bar brtsams te /

translated: Thus, in order to state the classification of renunciation, the elder Subh≈´ti, having begun the topic of the instruction in renunciation, which has the characteristic of the non-apprehension of all phenomena as previously stated,

translated: The Lord has taught the practice of renunciation, which has the characteristic of the pacification of the two extremes, and so on, and this is what troubles my mind.

analyzed: 'gyod pa ni brjod pa ma yin te ngan pa byas pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: glo ba la gcags pa ni mi shes pas byas pa'i skyon yin zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //

analyzed: dngos po ma 'tshal zhes bya ba ni rigs pas mtshungs pa nyid kyi chos rnams thams cad nyid do //
translated: The phrase not understanding things means all things that are the same in being mere conceptual imputations.

original: ming tsam bzung nas 'du ba dang 'god par ji ltar bgyi ste byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam mo //

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba yang blta bar bya ste de ltar gtso bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be seen in the same way, because it is the most important.

original: med par gyur pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni 'du ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: med par gyur pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni 'du ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The superimposition of what is nonexistent is called taking up,

original: yod par gyur pa la skur ba 'debs pa ni 'god par bgyid do //
analyzed: yod par gyur pa la skur ba 'debs pa ni 'god par bgyid do //

original: de la gal te med par gyur ba'i kun brtags dang gzhan dbang gi don dam par yod pa'i ngo bo brjod pa yin na sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: yongs su grub pa chos nyid kyi rang bzhin la yang don dam par med pa nyid kyis skur pa 'debs pa'i mthar ltung ba'o //

analyzed: yang na ngo bo nyid gsum yang cha gang gyod pa'i mtshan nyid can des bsnyod 'debs pa na skur pa'i mtha'o //

analyzed: gang gis med pa'i mtshan nyid can des yod pa nyid du brtags pa la sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha'o //

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it has been said:

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

analyzed: yod pa mtshan nyid kyis bzung ba//

analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin des //

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yang med pa ma yin te 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir ro //

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /

original: 'khrul pa'i ngo bor yod pa ste //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i ngo bor yod pa ste //

original: snang ba ji ltar yod ma yin //

analyzed: gang phyir gzhan gyi dbang des ni //

original: yod dang med pa'i mtshan nyid 'dod //

original: ces bya ba'o //üîΩyongs su grub @29a * //

translated: The perfected nature also cannot be said to exist, because it has the characteristic of nonexistence due to the nonexistence of the duality of the imagined object and subject.üîΩIt cannot be said that the characteristic of nonexistence exists.

original: med pa zhes bya ba yang smra bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba yang smra bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It cannot be said that it is nonexistent.

original: gang gi phyir gang dang bral ba'i ngo bos yod pa yin te de lta bu yang gal te yod pa zhes brjod na dngos po'i bdag nyid kyis yod ces thob pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs kyi mthar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang dang bral ba'i ngo bos yod pa yin te de lta bu yang gal te yod pa zhes brjod na dngos po'i bdag nyid kyis yod ces thob pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs kyi mthar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Because of what? It exists by the nature of being free from that. If such is called ‚Äúexistent,‚Äù then because it is obtained as ‚Äúexisting by the nature of a thing,‚Äù it is the extreme of superimposition.

analyzed: yod dang med pa'i mtshan nyid 'dod //

analyzed: ces bya'o // slar yang ming tsam de med par gsungs pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: gsungs pa ni mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis legs par gnas pa lags so zhes bya ba ste /

original: de nyid ni de la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni de la gnas pa'o //

analyzed: 'di ni sgrub pa 'di la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi ldog pa'i nges pas nges par 'byung ba nyid bstan to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva, and so on, up to

analyzed: rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bgyi'o //

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis so //
