analyzed: gang yang gzugs kyi stong pa nyid de ni gzugs ma yin te /
translated: That emptiness of form is not form.

original: stong pa nyid las gzhan du yang gzugs med la gzugs nyid @30a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gzhan du yang gzugs med la gzugs nyid @30a * //
translated: Form is not other than emptiness.

original: kyang stong pa nyid de stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kyang stong pa nyid de stong pa nyid kyang gzugs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Emptiness also is not other than form.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te gzugs la gnas par mi bya ste gang gi phyir gzugs ni gzugs nyid kyis stong zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te gzugs la gnas par mi bya ste gang gi phyir gzugs ni gzugs nyid kyis stong zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the intention: ‚ÄúDo not abide in form, because form is empty of form.‚Äù

original: 'dir gzugs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzugs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, form is threefold:

original: kun tu brtags pa'i gzugs dang / rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i gzugs dang / rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: imagined form, conceptually differentiated form, and the reality of form.

original: gang zhig 'di byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis gzugs su byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bzung bar gyur pa dang dngos po'i ngo bo can de ni kun tu brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis gzugs su byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bzung bar gyur pa dang dngos po'i ngo bo can de ni kun tu brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which is apprehended by the na√Øve, the ordinary person, as form, etc., and which has the nature of an entity is called imagined form.

original: de nyid ni rnam pa gang gis don snang ba la yul du gyur pa de ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rnam pa gang gis don snang ba la yul du gyur pa de ni rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That very form which appears as an object in a certain aspect is called conceptually differentiated form.

original: gang zhig rnam pa de dag dang bral ba yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid tsam pa de ni chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam pa de dag dang bral ba yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid tsam pa de ni chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The form of reality is that which is devoid of those aspects, the mere suchness of the perfected.

original: de la gang zhig 'di yongs su grub pa chos nyid kyi gzugs de ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid de bzhin nyid yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid can de ni gzugs ma yin /
analyzed: de la gang zhig 'di yongs su grub pa chos nyid kyi gzugs de ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid de bzhin nyid yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid can de ni gzugs ma yin /
translated: The form of reality, which is the perfected, is the emptiness of the imagined reality. It has the characteristic of the perfected suchness. It is not form.

original: de gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin te rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi rnam pa dang rnam par bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin te rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi rnam pa dang rnam par bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the intrinsic reality of form, because it is completely devoid of the aspects of form.

original: gal te de ltar na rnam pa thams cad du gzugs med pa yin na gang gis 'di stong pa nyid yin zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rnam pa thams cad du gzugs med pa yin na gang gis 'di stong pa nyid yin zhes brjod do //
translated: If it is completely devoid of form, how can it be said to be emptiness?

original: gang gi phyir yul dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because emptiness is not devoid of an object.

original: chos las gzhan du gyur ba'i chos nyid kyang mi rigs la /
analyzed: chos las gzhan du gyur ba'i chos nyid kyang mi rigs la /
translated: It is not tenable that reality is different from the thing.

original: chos nyid las gzhan pa'i chos kyang rigs pa ma yin no zhes the tshom za ba la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: chos nyid las gzhan pa'i chos kyang rigs pa ma yin no zhes the tshom za ba la brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is not reasonable for there to be a phenomenon that is other than reality.

original: stong pa nyid las gzhan pa gzugs yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gzhan pa gzugs yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement, ‚ÄúForm does not exist apart from emptiness.‚Äù

original: ci zhig gsungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci zhig gsungs par 'gyur /
translated: What is it that is said?

original: ji ltar ma dag pa'i chu ni ma dag pa'i gnas skabs la 'dam zhes brjod la dag pa'i gnas skabs su chu zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ji ltar ma dag pa'i chu ni ma dag pa'i gnas skabs la 'dam zhes brjod la dag pa'i gnas skabs su chu zhes brjod do //
translated: Just as impure water is called ‚Äúmuddy‚Äù when it is in an impure state and is called ‚Äúwater‚Äù when it is in a pure state.

original: ji ltar ma dag pa'i gnas skabs la nam mkha' ni yul ngan zhes brjod la dag pa'i gnas skabs su nam mkha' zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ma dag pa'i gnas skabs la nam mkha' ni yul ngan zhes brjod la dag pa'i gnas skabs su nam mkha' zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the sky is called ‚Äúbad weather‚Äù when it is in an impure state and is called ‚Äúsky‚Äù when it is in a pure state.

original: de bzhin du stong pa nyid 'di yang byis pa rnams la ma dag pa'i gnas skabs su so sor gyur pa ma yin ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis mngon par @30b brjod pa yin la dag pa'i gnas skabs la stong pa nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa nyid 'di yang byis pa rnams la ma dag pa'i gnas skabs su so sor gyur pa ma yin ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyis mngon par @30b brjod pa yin la dag pa'i gnas skabs la stong pa nyid ces brjod do //
translated: In the same way, this emptiness is described by the terms ‚Äúform,‚Äù etc., which are not distinct from it, when it is in an impure state for the immature. It is called ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù when it is in a pure state.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid las so sor gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid las so sor gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not a phenomenon such as form that is separate from emptiness.

original: de ltar yang chos dang chos nyid dag tha mi dad par yod pa la brgya lam na gzugs nyid stong pa nyid du brjod de /üîΩgang gi tshe chos nyid kyis chos brjod par 'dod na brgya lam na stong pa nyid la gzugs zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang chos dang chos nyid dag tha mi dad par yod pa la brgya lam na gzugs nyid stong pa nyid du brjod de / gang gi tshe chos nyid kyis chos brjod par 'dod na brgya lam na stong pa nyid la gzugs zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the dharma and its reality are not different, form itself is said to be emptiness.üîΩWhen one wishes to express the dharma by means of its reality, emptiness is said to be form.üîΩWhen one wishes to express the reality of the dharma, form itself is said to be emptiness, the reality of form.

original: gang gi tshe chos kyi chos nyid brjod par 'dod na yang de na gzugs nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba chos nyid kyi gzugs nyid stong pa nyid ces brjod de stong pa nyid kho na gzugs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos kyi chos nyid brjod par 'dod na yang de na gzugs nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba chos nyid kyi gzugs nyid stong pa nyid ces brjod de stong pa nyid kho na gzugs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Emptiness itself is form.

original: stong pa nyid ni de bzhin kho na ste chos nyid kyi gzugs brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni de bzhin kho na ste chos nyid kyi gzugs brjod pa yin no //
translated: Emptiness is just as it is, the reality of form.

original: de nyid kyi tshe kun tu brtags pa dang rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dag la shin tu med pas yongs su grub pa la yang gnas par mi rung ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe kun tu brtags pa dang rnam par brtags pa'i gzugs dag la shin tu med pas yongs su grub pa la yang gnas par mi rung ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: At that time, since imputed form and conceptually differentiated form do not exist at all, it is not possible to abide in the perfected nature.üîΩThus, it is said:

original: gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: gzugs la gnas par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba ste //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not abide in form.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar bar ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar bar ba'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to feelings and so on.

original: de ltar mi gnas pa'i sgrub pa nye bar bstan nas gnas pa la nyes dmigs bstan par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar mi gnas pa'i sgrub pa nye bar bstan nas gnas pa la nyes dmigs bstan par byed de /
translated: Having thus taught the practice of nonabiding, he teaches the danger in abiding.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩIf one abides in form,

original: gal te gzugs la gnas na zhes bya ba ni gzugs thabs mi mkhas pa nyid kyis tshul bzhin ma yin ba bzung nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid chos rnams la ma shes shing bdag ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin zhe'am bdag gi 'di gzugs
analyzed: gal te gzugs la gnas na zhes bya ba ni gzugs thabs mi mkhas pa nyid kyis tshul bzhin ma yin ba bzung nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid chos rnams la ma shes shing bdag ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin zhe'am bdag gi 'di gzugs
translated: then, due to lack of skill in means, one grasps incorrectly, does not understand the nature of phenomena, which is the absence of an intrinsic nature, and thinks, ‚ÄúI am the nature of form,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis is mine,‚Äù or ‚ÄúForm is mine.‚Äù

original: she'am gzugs kyi mtshan nyid 'di zhes bya ba ni gzugs la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: she'am gzugs kyi mtshan nyid 'di zhes bya ba ni gzugs la gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is called ‚Äúabiding in form.‚Äù

original: de ni gzugs kyi mngon par 'du byed pa gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su song ba'i 'du byed kyi chos la spyod de stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang rjes su 'brang ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la ni ma
analyzed: de ni gzugs kyi mngon par 'du byed pa gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su song ba'i 'du byed kyi chos la spyod de stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang rjes su 'brang ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la ni ma
translated: That is the practice of the phenomena of formative forces that are in accord with the conceptual thoughts of form, and not the practice of the perfection of wisdom that is in accord with the characteristic of emptiness.

original: yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i spyod pa la yang nyes dmigs bstan par byed de mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i spyod pa la yang nyes dmigs bstan par byed de mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa ma lags pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The disadvantages of the practice of formative forces are also taught: If one practices with formative forces, one does not fully grasp the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la ltung ba mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod cing shes @31a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la ltung ba mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod cing shes @31a * //
translated: Why does one practice with the formative forces of falling into the apprehension of self and the apprehension of self and other?

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang rnal 'byor thob pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa dang nges par 'byung ba rnams thob pa ma yin zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang rnal 'byor thob pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa dang nges par 'byung ba rnams thob pa ma yin zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not grasped, nor is the attainment of yoga, nor is the attainment of perfection and liberation.

original: yongs su mi bzung ba yongs su bzung bas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su mi bzung ba yongs su bzung bas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, By not grasping, grasping is grasped.

original: ji ltar yongs su mi 'dzin pa 'dzin par byed ces gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su mi 'dzin pa 'dzin par byed ces gsungs pa /
translated: It is said, How is non-grasping grasped?

original: gzugs yongs su bzung ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs yongs su bzung ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said, Form is not grasped, and so on.

original: 'di ni yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i sgrub pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i sgrub pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is called the practice of non-grasping.

original: sgrub pa 'di yang rnam pa gsum du bstan pa yin te chos yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / ye shes yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa 'di yang rnam pa gsum du bstan pa yin te chos yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / ye shes yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: This practice is also taught to be threefold: not grasping phenomena, not grasping wisdom, and not grasping signs.

original: de la chos mi 'dzin pa'i dus ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gzugs yongs su bzung ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la chos mi 'dzin pa'i dus ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gzugs yongs su bzung ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Regarding that, the time of not grasping phenomena is from The perfection of wisdom is not grasped up to Form is not grasped.

original: ji srid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang yongs su bzung ba ma mchis te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: ji srid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang yongs su bzung ba ma mchis te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: As long as even that omniscience is not grasped.

original: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'i dus ni mtshan mar bzung ba ma lags so //
analyzed: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'i dus ni mtshan mar bzung ba ma lags so //
translated: The time of not apprehending signs is not apprehending signs.

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning from here,

original: ji srid rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: ji srid rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: as long as consciousness is not grasped.

original: ye shes yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i dus ni de la shes pa de dga' ba dang bde ba yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: ye shes yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i dus ni de la shes pa de dga' ba dang bde ba yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The time of not grasping wisdom is not seeing that knowledge as joy and happiness, beginning from here,

original: ji srid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: ji srid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: as long as it should be known as the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la dang po chos yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i dus la /
analyzed: de la dang po chos yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i dus la /
translated: Therein, at the time of not grasping phenomena,

original: gzugs yongs su bzung ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos nyid kyi gzugs ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la ltung ba'i rgyud gang gis kyang gzugs nyid du yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs yongs su bzung ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos nyid kyi gzugs ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la ltung ba'i rgyud gang gis kyang gzugs nyid du yongs su 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúForm is not apprehended‚Äù means that because the form of reality is not apprehended as form by any continuum that falls into the apprehension of a self and the apprehension of ‚Äúmine,‚Äù

original: de'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod cing don dam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la spyod par mi byed ces bya ba bstan par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa la spyod cing don dam pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la spyod par mi byed ces bya ba bstan par byed de /
translated: it is taught that ‚Äúone does not engage in the practice of the perfection of wisdom of ultimate reality while engaging in the practice of manifest compositional activity.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin zhes bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin zhes bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: Why is form not apprehended?

original: gzugs yongs su bzung ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ni gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba ste 'dir ni yongs su mi @31b 'dzin zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs yongs su bzung ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ni gzugs ma lags zhes bya ba ste 'dir ni yongs su mi @31b 'dzin zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid brjod pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is the non-apprehension of form is not form‚Äù is stated here. The characteristic of the consummate is expressed as ‚Äúnon-apprehension.‚Äù

original: gang zhig chos nyid kyi gzugs la yongs su mi 'dzin pa yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin de ni kun tu brtags pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig chos nyid kyi gzugs la yongs su mi 'dzin pa yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin de ni kun tu brtags pa'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the perfected, which does not apprehend the form of reality, is not the nature of the imagined form.

original: de bas na chos nyid kyi gzugs yongs su ma bzung zhes sbyar bar bya ste don ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de bas na chos nyid kyi gzugs yongs su ma bzung zhes sbyar bar bya ste don ni 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúthe form of reality is not apprehended‚Äù should be applied, and this is the meaning.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig sngar yongs su bzung nas phyis gzhan gang gis kyang stong par byed pa ma yin te 'on kyang stong pa nyid de'i rang bzhin de'i phyir de la yongs su 'dzin pa yang dag par 'byung ba gang las yin
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam pa 'ga' zhig sngar yongs su bzung nas phyis gzhan gang gis kyang stong par byed pa ma yin te 'on kyang stong pa nyid de'i rang bzhin de'i phyir de la yongs su 'dzin pa yang dag par 'byung ba gang las yin
translated: After having previously apprehended some aspect of a phenomenon such as form, it is not later made empty by anything else; rather, it is empty by its very nature. Therefore, how could the apprehension of it arise?

original: / de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to feelings and so on.

original: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i chos brjod pa ming tsam ting nge 'dzin la gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i chos brjod pa ming tsam ting nge 'dzin la gsungs pa /
translated: This is also stated in the concentration of the bodhisattva‚Äôs expression of Dharma, which is merely a name.

original: chos rnams thams cad yongs su ma bzung ba gang la de ni de ltar brjod do //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad yongs su ma bzung ba gang la de ni de ltar brjod do //
translated: All phenomena are not fully grasped, and that is what is being referred to here.

original: yangs pa ni yangs pa'i chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yangs pa ni yangs pa'i chos kyi dbyings la dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Vast means that it is vast because it takes the realm of phenomena as its object.

original: mdun du bgyis pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis rab tu bsngags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdun du bgyis pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis rab tu bsngags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is made prominent because it is highly praised by all the buddhas.

original: tshad med pa ni sangs rgyas nyid de de la nges pa'i phyir tshad med par nges pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni sangs rgyas nyid de de la nges pa'i phyir tshad med par nges pa'o //
translated: It is infinite because it is certain in infinite buddhahood.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang yongs su bzung ba ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang yongs su bzung ba ma mchis pa ste /
translated: That omniscience is also ungrasped.

original: gang gi phyir stong pa nyid thams cad kyis shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa'i ye shes chos thams cad mi dmigs pa yongs su mthar thug pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir stong pa nyid thams cad kyis shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa'i ye shes chos thams cad mi dmigs pa yongs su mthar thug pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'byung ba ste /
translated: Because the knowledge that is completely purified by all emptinesses arises as the knowledge of all aspects that is the culmination of the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: de bas na de yang yongs su bzung ba zhes bstan par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na de yang yongs su bzung ba zhes bstan par byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is also taught as ungrasped.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: mtshan mar bzung ba ma lags so //
analyzed: mtshan mar bzung ba ma lags so //
translated: It is not grasped as a sign.

original: zhes bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan mas rnam par bral bar rnam pa thams cad du mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba'i son to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mtshan mas rnam par bral bar rnam pa thams cad du mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa can zhes bya ba'i son to //

original: 'dis kyang sh'a ri'i bu gzugs nyid gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gang gi yin zhes bya ba'i dri ba don gcig gis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang sh'a ri'i bu gzugs nyid gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gang gi yin zhes bya ba'i dri ba don gcig gis bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the question ‚ÄúWhose is this perfection of wisdom?‚Äù with the same meaning as ‚ÄúForm itself is separated from the intrinsic nature of form,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di lta ste chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis bral ba rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyis bral ba rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: It is like this: all dharmas are separated by nature, without intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar yod pa la chos gang rtogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rig bar bya zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa la chos gang rtogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rig bar bya zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught that ‚Äúby realizing the existence of any dharma, it should be known as the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe 'di gang gi zhes bya ba la rgyu la 'dri ba de'i tshe na yang lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di gang gi zhes bya ba la rgyu la 'dri ba de'i tshe na yang lan gsungs pa /
translated: When it is asked ‚Äúin regard to what?‚Äù in regard to the cause, the answer is given:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan nyid dang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩchos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i rgyus shes rab kyi pha rol tu @34a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan nyid dang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i rgyus shes rab kyi pha rol tu @34a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe perfection of wisdom is also in regard to the characteristic, etc.‚Äù

original: phyin pa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: phyin pa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is to be established by the cause of the realization of the characteristic of all dharmas.

original: gang gi tshe na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par bral ba de'i tshe mtshan nyid gang rnams la rtogs par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par bral ba de'i tshe mtshan nyid gang rnams la rtogs par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: When the perfection of wisdom itself is devoid of its own characteristic, then in regard to what characteristics will there be realization?

original: mtshan nyid thams cad kyang kun tu brtags pa ste med par gyur pa de'i tshe chos nyid kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid dang rnam par bral ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid thams cad kyang kun tu brtags pa ste med par gyur pa de'i tshe chos nyid kyi rang bzhin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mtshan nyid dang rnam par bral ba zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: When all characteristics are totally imagined and non-existent, then the nature of reality, the perfection of wisdom, is said to be devoid of characteristics.

original: da ni 'di gang gi zhes bya ba gang gi tshe byed pa la 'dri ba de la gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'di gang gi zhes bya ba gang gi tshe byed pa la 'dri ba de la gsungs pa /
translated: Now, this is asked: ‚ÄúWhose?‚Äù When it is asked in terms of the agent, it is said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor yang ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor yang ci zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable Subh≈´ti, what is the going forth of a bodhisattva?‚Äù

original: nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The practice of going forth is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: nges par 'byung ba de yang chos rnams thams cad la yang yod pa ma yin te gang gi phyir chos rnams thams cad ni nges par ma byung ba ste ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba de yang chos rnams thams cad la yang yod pa ma yin te gang gi phyir chos rnams thams cad ni nges par ma byung ba ste ma skyes pa'o //
translated: And that going forth does not exist in any phenomena, because all phenomena are not gone forth, not arisen.

original: de'i phyir yang nges par 'byung ba nyid yod pa ma yin la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang nges par 'byung ba nyid yod pa ma yin la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, going forth itself does not exist. The meaning is this:

original: yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs su chos nyid kyi ngo bo can gyi chos rnams la bdag nyid la phyin ci log med pa'i phyir glo bur ba'i nges par 'byung ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i gnas skabs su chos nyid kyi ngo bo can gyi chos rnams la bdag nyid la phyin ci log med pa'i phyir glo bur ba'i nges par 'byung ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In the phase of the consummate, phenomena that have the nature of reality do not have adventitious going forth, because they are not mistaken with respect to themselves.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir dang chos nyid la mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir dang chos nyid la mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of its natural purity and because of the immutability of reality.

original: 'khor ba'i gnas skabs la kun nas nyon mongs pa can kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po rnams kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyi ngo bos skye ba ni bskyed pa med pa'i tshe de ltar nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i gnas skabs la kun nas nyon mongs pa can kun tu brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po rnams kyi chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyi ngo bos skye ba ni bskyed pa med pa'i tshe de ltar nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: In the situation of cyclic existence, the reality of things that are the nature of the afflictions is not produced by the nature of the imagined. When there is no production, there is no emergence in that way.

original: dri ma dang bral ba'i gnas su skyed pa med de dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs su zhes bya ba nye bar bstan nas nges par 'byung ba nyid mjug bsdu bar byed de /
analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba'i gnas su skyed pa med de dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs su zhes bya ba nye bar bstan nas nges par 'byung ba nyid mjug bsdu bar byed de /
translated: There is no production in the situation of being free from defilements. Having indicated the situation of being together with defilements, he concludes the emergence.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ltar spyod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ltar spyod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ≈öƒÅriputra, the bodhisattva who practices like this‚Äù and so on.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngag gis rgyu ba de'i spyod pa de zhes des na 'di ltar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngag gis rgyu ba de'i spyod pa de zhes des na 'di ltar brjod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúApproaches omniscience‚Äù is stated by himself. That practice of him is like that. Therefore, this is said.

original: gang gi tshe brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i phul su tshogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rtsol ba dan ldan pa spyod pa la spyod pa zhes brjod par 'dod pa de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i phul su tshogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rtsol ba dan ldan pa spyod pa la spyod pa zhes brjod par 'dod pa de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: When one is endowed with the best of effort and so on, one is called a bodhisattva who is ‚Äúendowed with striving‚Äù and ‚Äúengaged in the practice.‚Äù

original: thams @34b cad mkhyen pa nyid la nye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //üîΩslar yang yang dag par ni ci lta ci ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'gres par du bklags nas yang dang yang du nye bar bsdu ba 'don par byed de 'gres 'di yang ni sngar gyi po ti rnams
analyzed: thams @34b cad mkhyen pa nyid la nye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o // slar yang yang dag par ni ci lta ci ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la nye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i 'gres par du bklags nas yang dang yang du nye bar bsdu ba 'don par byed de 'gres 'di yang ni sngar gyi po ti rnams
translated: One becomes close to omniscience.

original: la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Again, one should read the passage beginning ‚ÄúJust as, just as‚Äù and so on, with the repetition ‚Äúbecomes close to omniscience‚Äù and so on. This repetition is not found in the earlier editions.

original: de bas na mngon par rtogs pa la sbyar ba'i don du rab tu bzhag pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na mngon par rtogs pa la sbyar ba'i don du rab tu bzhag pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the presentation occurs for the purpose of application to realization.

original: de ltar nye ba'i brtags pa'i sgrub pa bshad nas rig pa'i sgrub pa bshad par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar nye ba'i brtags pa'i sgrub pa bshad nas rig pa'i sgrub pa bshad par byed de /
translated: Having explained the proof of the close approximation, he explains the proof of the knowledge.

original: gal te gzugs la spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams te /
translated: If one engages in form, etc.üîΩ

original: spyad par bya ba yang ma yin la spyad par mi bya ba yang ma yin pa nyid do snyam du nye bar mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis so //
analyzed: spyad par bya ba yang ma yin la spyad par mi bya ba yang ma yin pa nyid do snyam du nye bar mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung gis so //
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúIf one engages in form‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúone should not think that it is neither to be practiced nor not to be practiced‚Äù explains this.

original: rigs pa'i sgrub pa 'di ni rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: rigs pa'i sgrub pa 'di ni rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: This rational demonstration is shown by two aspects:

original: thabs ma yin pa yongs su spang ba dang / thabs la bsnyen pa'o /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa yongs su spang ba dang / thabs la bsnyen pa'o /
translated: abandoning the unskillful means and approaching the skillful means.

original: de la thabs ma yin pa ni mtshan ma la spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de la thabs ma yin pa ni mtshan ma la spyod pa ste /
translated: The unskillful means is the practice of signs.

original: de gsungs pa ni gal te gzugs la spyod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de gsungs pa ni gal te gzugs la spyod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams te /
translated: That is taught in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúIf one engages in form‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúone should not think that it is neither to be practiced nor not to be practiced.‚Äù

original: thabs mi mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: thabs mi mkhas par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: The skillful means is the practice of signlessness.üîΩThat is taught in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúIf one engages in signlessness‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúone should not think that it is neither to be practiced nor not to be practiced.‚Äù

original: gal te gzugs la spyod ces bya ba ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo la gal te spyod na de'i tshe 'di ni gzugs zhes bya bar mngon par zhen pa na mtshan ma med pa dor nas spyod cing mtshan ma la spyod do //
analyzed: gal te gzugs la spyod ces bya ba ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo la gal te spyod na de'i tshe 'di ni gzugs zhes bya bar mngon par zhen pa na mtshan ma med pa dor nas spyod cing mtshan ma la spyod do //
translated: If one engages with form, if one engages with the imagined nature, then at that time, when one conceives of this as form, one engages with the sign, having abandoned signlessness.

original: gang gi tshe na yang 'di'i gzugs yongs su dor nas gzugs kyi mtshan ma la spyod pa de'i tshe na mtshan ma nyid mar byas te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na yang 'di'i gzugs yongs su dor nas gzugs kyi mtshan ma la spyod pa de'i tshe na mtshan ma nyid mar byas te /
translated: When one engages with the sign of form, having abandoned form, at that time, one engages with the sign itself.

original: mngon par zhen pas mtshan ma'i spyod pa nyid do //üîΩgal te gzugs la so sor gzugs kyi mtshan ma la spyod pa na mtshan ma'i sbyor ba ni mtshan ma'i spyod pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pas mtshan ma'i spyod pa nyid do // gal te gzugs la so sor gzugs kyi mtshan ma la spyod pa na mtshan ma'i sbyor ba ni mtshan ma'i spyod pa ste /
translated: Due to attachment, one engages with the sign.üîΩIf one engages with form, discriminating the sign of form, one engages with the sign of engagement with the sign.

original: de'i gzugs nyid mtshan ma zhes gnyi g-yang gcig tu byas nas spyod par 'gyur ba ste de nyid gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de'i gzugs nyid mtshan ma zhes gnyi g-yang gcig tu byas nas spyod par 'gyur ba ste de nyid gsungs pa ni /
translated: When one engages with form and the sign of form as a pair, one engages with the sign.üîΩThis is stated:

original: gal te gzugs kyi mtshan ma la spyod na zhes bya ba ni de lta na yang mtshan ma'i spyod pa nyid ces gsungs pa ni mtshan ma la spyod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te gzugs kyi mtshan ma la spyod na zhes bya ba ni de lta na yang mtshan ma'i spyod pa nyid ces gsungs pa ni mtshan ma la spyod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one engages in the signs of form, then even so, it is said that one engages in the signs of form.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi skye ba la ni ma byung ba la 'byung ba la'o 'gag pa ni byung nas log pa la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi skye ba la ni ma byung ba la 'byung ba la'o 'gag pa ni byung nas log pa la'o //
translated: Similarly, the arising of form is the origination of what was not. The cessation of form is the reversal of what has originated.

original: 'jig pa la ni skad cig ma re re rnam par 'jig pa la'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa la ni skad cig ma re re rnam par 'jig pa la'o //
translated: The destruction of form is the moment-by-moment disintegration of form.

original: 'o na gzugs @35a * //
analyzed: 'o na gzugs @35a * //
translated: But form is empty!

original: ni stong pa yin mod ces bya bas mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa de yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: ni stong pa yin mod ces bya bas mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa de yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, it is said that one engages in the signless.

original: mtshan ma la spyod do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma la spyod do zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said that one engages in the signs of form.

original: gal te gzugs stong ngo zhes stong pa 'di la 'dir mngon par zhen pa yin na de yang mtshan ma'i spyod pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te gzugs stong ngo zhes stong pa 'di la 'dir mngon par zhen pa yin na de yang mtshan ma'i spyod pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one is attached to the emptiness of form, thinking that form is empty, then that is also said to be the engagement in the signs of form.

original: gal te yang de 'di snyam du gang de ltar spyod pa de ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa mtshan ma 'gag pa'i sgo nas yang spyod cing 'gag pa'i mtshan ma nyid rang bzhin la spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te yang de 'di snyam du gang de ltar spyod pa de ni zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa mtshan ma 'gag pa'i sgo nas yang spyod cing 'gag pa'i mtshan ma nyid rang bzhin la spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If, however, he thinks, he who practices thus, etc., he practices the sign of cessation of form, etc., and practices the sign of cessation itself in the nature. This is the meaning.

original: thabs la mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba ste rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: thabs la mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba ste rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The phrase unskillful in means refers to the result called knowledge of all things.

original: de'i yang kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo rnam par sgom pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: de'i yang kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo rnam par sgom pa ni thabs so //
translated: The cultivation of the imagined nature of that is the means.

original: kun brtags med pa'i shes pa yang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo brdzun pa'i rnam pa tsam zhes grub pa yin no //
analyzed: kun brtags med pa'i shes pa yang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo brdzun pa'i rnam pa tsam zhes grub pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the non-existence of the imagined is the establishment of the mere false aspect of the nature of dependence.

original: 'khrul pa'i ngo bo de yang log pa na gnyis dang gnyis su snang ba dang med pa'i ngo bo spyi'i mtshan nyid can nyid kun tu brtags pa dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo thams cad dang rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par mi ldan pas dang po la snang
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i ngo bo de yang log pa na gnyis dang gnyis su snang ba dang med pa'i ngo bo spyi'i mtshan nyid can nyid kun tu brtags pa dang gzhan dbang gi ngo bo thams cad dang rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par mi ldan pas dang po la snang
translated: When the essence of delusion is reversed, the essence of the nonexistence of duality and the appearance of duality is the general characteristic of the imagined and the dependent. Since it is not endowed with its own characteristics, it appears in the first.üîΩ

original: ba yin no //
analyzed: ba yin no //
translated: When the essence of error is reversed, the essence of nonexistence, which is the general characteristic of the two and the appearance of the two, is the imagined nature and the nature of the dependent. Since it is completely devoid of its own characteristics, it is the first appearance.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /üîΩde nyid don la so sor rtogs //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa / de nyid don la so sor rtogs //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe individual understanding of reality

original: cig car mtshan nyid gsum po ni //
analyzed: cig car mtshan nyid gsum po ni //
translated: Simultaneously understands the three characteristics.

original: yongs su shes pa spang ba dang // thob pa rim pa ji bzhin 'dod //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa spang ba dang // thob pa rim pa ji bzhin 'dod //
translated: Understanding, abandonment, and attainment are asserted to be sequential.

original: yongs su shes ni mi dmigs 'dir //
analyzed: yongs su shes ni mi dmigs 'dir //
translated: Understanding is nonobservation here.

original: spang ba mi snang 'dod pa ste //üîΩnye bar dmigs pa nus pa la //
analyzed: spang ba mi snang 'dod pa ste // nye bar dmigs pa nus pa la //
translated: Abandonment is asserted to be nonappearance.üîΩAttainment is the ability to observe.

original: thob pa mngon du bya ba ste //
analyzed: thob pa mngon du bya ba ste //
translated: Attainment is the actualization of nonobservation.

original: gnyis po ngag ni mi dmigs pas //
analyzed: gnyis po ngag ni mi dmigs pas //
translated: The two are nonobservation.

original: gnyis med rnam par rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis med rnam par rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: Nonduality is realized.

original: rnam par bral bas de grub pa //
analyzed: rnam par bral bas de grub pa //
translated: Separation establishes that.

original: gnyis su med pa rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: Nonduality is realized.

original: glang po che ni mi dmigs dang // de yi rnam pa rnam bral ba //
analyzed: glang po che ni mi dmigs dang // de yi rnam pa rnam bral ba //
translated: The elephant is not observed, and its aspects are free.

original: zhing la nye bar dmigs pa ni //
analyzed: zhing la nye bar dmigs pa ni //
translated: The field is observed as

original: ci ltar cig car sgyu ma la //
analyzed: ci ltar cig car sgyu ma la //
translated: Just as an illusion is simultaneous,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: de'i 'og tu rjes kyi shes pas gzhan dbang ma chad pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon gal te yang snang ba de ltar na yang mthong ba'i lam la stong pa nyid kyi ngo bos mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rjes kyi shes pas gzhan dbang ma chad pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon gal te yang snang ba de ltar na yang mthong ba'i lam la stong pa nyid kyi ngo bos mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid shes pa nyid de /
translated: After that, if the seed of the latent tendencies of the uninterrupted dependent origination is also seen in that way by subsequent cognition, then it is the knowledge of the nature of seeing through the entity of emptiness on the path of seeing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par mi rtog pa la zhugs pa la gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par mi rtog pa la zhugs pa la gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said to be engaged in nonconceptuality:

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni @35b shes bya dang khyad par med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi nam mkha'i dkyil dang mnyam pa'i chos thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni @35b shes bya dang khyad par med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi nam mkha'i dkyil dang mnyam pa'i chos thams cad mthong ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in the nonconceptual dhƒÅtu sees all phenomena as the sky-like sameness of nonconceptual wisdom, which is no different than the object of knowledge.

original: de'i rjes la thob pa'i sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang rmi lam dang snang ba dang / brag ca dang gzugs brnyan dang chu zla dang sprul pa dang mtshungs pa'i chos rnams mthong ngo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa'i sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang rmi lam dang snang ba dang / brag ca dang gzugs brnyan dang chu zla dang sprul pa dang mtshungs pa'i chos rnams mthong ngo zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, he sees phenomena as being like an illusion, a mirage, a dream, a visual aberration, an echo, a reflection, the moon in water, an emanation, and a magical creation.

original: de ltar mngon sum du bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings la dri ma dang bral bar byed pas sangs rgyas kyi sa la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar mngon sum du bya ba'i chos kyi dbyings la dri ma dang bral bar byed pas sangs rgyas kyi sa la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, because he makes the dharmadhƒÅtu, which is to be realized, free from stains, he is called the one who has the knowledge of all aspects on the buddha stage.

original: mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i kun brtags pa'i ngo bo las ma 'das pa ci'i phyir stong pa nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba ni thabs la mi mkhas pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i kun brtags pa'i ngo bo las ma 'das pa ci'i phyir stong pa nyid mthong ba zhes bya ba ni thabs la mi mkhas pa nyid do //

analyzed: 'on te stong pa nyid rtag pa yin na de'i tshe de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yang rtag par 'gyur zhen 'di'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: But if emptiness is permanent, then at that time, because it is not different from that, error would also be permanent.

original: gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to teach this, he says:

original: gang zhig yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo de rnams 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin kun tu brtags pa'i chos rnams ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo de rnams 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin kun tu brtags pa'i chos rnams ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is the perfected nature is not the phenomena of the imagined nature, which is the nature of error.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: ming ni gang dang gang gis kyang //
analyzed: ming ni gang dang gang gis kyang //
translated: By whatever names

original: chos ni gang zhig mngon par brjod //
analyzed: chos ni gang zhig mngon par brjod //
translated: Whatever phenomena are expressed

original: kun tu brtags pa nyid 'di ste //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa nyid 'di ste //
translated: Are just the imagined

original: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And do not exist intrinsically.

original: gzhan ni dbang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni dbang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: The other is the dependent nature,

original: rnam rtog rkyen las byung ba ste //üîΩyongs grub de yi sngar du yang //
analyzed: rnam rtog rkyen las byung ba ste // yongs grub de yi sngar du yang //
translated: Which arises from conditions and is imagined.üîΩThe perfected is that which is

original: rtag tu gang zhig bral ba nyid //
analyzed: rtag tu gang zhig bral ba nyid //
translated: Always and forever free from the former.

original: de nyid phyir yang gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid phyir yang gzhan ma yin //
translated: For that very reason, it is not different,

original: mi gzhan ma yin gzhan dbang las //
analyzed: mi gzhan ma yin gzhan dbang las //
translated: But is different from the dependent.

original: brjod bya mi rtag la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: brjod bya mi rtag la sogs bzhin //
translated: Like the expressed, it is impermanent,üîΩAnd like the expression, it is permanent.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: gzhan dbang de'i phyir gyi kun tu brtags pas bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan dbang gi chos kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan dbang de'i phyir gyi kun tu brtags pas bral ba nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan dbang gi chos kyis so //
translated: Because of that, the other-dependent is free from the imagined, i.e., by the other-dependent nature.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa chos nyid kyi ngo bo yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs su gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pa chos nyid kyi ngo bo yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs su gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the absolute, which is inexpressible by identity or difference, is the perfected nature, in the state of being associated with defilement.

original: rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs su ni gzhan dbang chad pa nyid de'i dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs su ni gzhan dbang chad pa nyid de'i dmigs so //
translated: In the state of purification, the other-dependent is the object of that.

original: de'i tshe na yang chos nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na yang chos nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: At that time, it is called the absolute.

original: sngon gyi rjes su 'gro ba tha snyad do //
analyzed: sngon gyi rjes su 'gro ba tha snyad do //
translated: The conventional is the antecedent.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: glang po che ni mi dmigs pas //
analyzed: glang po che ni mi dmigs pas //
translated: The elephant is not perceived,

original: de yi rnam pa'i rnam pa bral //üîΩzhing gi nye bar dmigs pa yang //
analyzed: de yi rnam pa'i rnam pa bral // zhing gi nye bar dmigs pa yang //
translated: but its form is not absent.üîΩThe perception of the field

original: ji ltar cig car sgyu ma la'o //
analyzed: ji ltar cig car sgyu ma la'o //
translated: is simultaneous with the illusion.

original: bstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: And in the treatise:

original: yang dag ma yin kun brtags nyid //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun brtags nyid //
translated: The false imagination itself

original: de phyir 'di las grub pa yin //
analyzed: de phyir 'di las grub pa yin //
translated: Therefore, it is established from this.

original: thams cad yod phyir de ltar med //
analyzed: thams cad yod phyir de ltar med //
translated: Because everything exists, it is not like that.

original: de zad pas na grol bar 'dod //
analyzed: de zad pas na grol bar 'dod //
translated: By exhausting that, liberation is asserted.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gzhan dbang de zad pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la kun tu brtags pa las tha dad pa nye bar bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan dbang de zad pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la kun tu brtags pa las tha dad pa nye bar bstan pa la'o //
translated: The so-called exhaustion of that dependent nature is taught as being different from the imagined emptiness.

original: yongs su grub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni ci zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ni ci zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: With regard to the perfected, it is said, What is it? and so forth.

original: don dam par byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi @52b phyir mngon bar ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don dam par byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi @52b phyir mngon bar ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: In the ultimate, phenomena such as bodhisattvas have the characteristic of non-establishment, because they are of the nature of the dharmadhatu.

original: de'i phyir de rnams la spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir gdams pa la mi nus pa nyid ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams la spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir gdams pa la mi nus pa nyid ces bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because they transcend all conceptual elaborations, the intention is that they are not suitable as instructions.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i don bstan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach the meaning just explained, it is said:

original: mngon par ma grub pa las gzhan na zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa las gzhan na zhes bya ba ste //
translated: Apart from non-establishment,

original: chos thams cad dam zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa shes bya rnams so //
analyzed: chos thams cad dam zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa shes bya rnams so //
translated: All phenomena‚Äù refers to the aggregates, etc., which are objects of knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas chos sam zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba rtogs pa dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos sam zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba rtogs pa dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Buddha‚Äôs Dharma‚Äù refers to the realizations and fearlessnesses, etc., which are to be attained.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos sam zhes bya ba ni sngar thob pa'i yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos sam zhes bya ba ni sngar thob pa'i yon tan rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Dharma of the Bodhisattvas‚Äù refers to the previously attained virtues.

original: gang byang chub tu spyod pa la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub tu spyod pa la zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who practices for enlightenment‚Äù is a Bodhisattva.

original: 'di rnams thams cad don dam pa'i gnas skabs su mngon par ma grub pa las gzhan du zhes stong pa nyid las tha dad pas dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad don dam pa'i gnas skabs su mngon par ma grub pa las gzhan du zhes stong pa nyid las tha dad pas dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: All of these are not objects of apprehension apart from non-establishment in the ultimate situation, i.e., apart from emptiness.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kho na de'i tshe 'ba' zhig lhag par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kho na de'i tshe 'ba' zhig lhag par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: At that time, only the emptiness which is the nature of the extremely pure Dharma-Sphere remains.

original: de bas na spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir gdams pa yang dag par yod pa ma yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na spros pa thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir gdams pa yang dag par yod pa ma yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it transcends all conceptual elaborations, it is taught that there is no true instruction.

original: de ltar don dam pa'i ngo bo byang chub sems dpa' rnams nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar don dam pa'i ngo bo byang chub sems dpa' rnams nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the essence of the ultimate,

original: don dam pa'i spyod pa bshad par byed de /
analyzed: don dam pa'i spyod pa bshad par byed de /
translated: the author now explains the practice of the ultimate.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, if a Bodhisattva, a great being, should practice the perfection of wisdom, how should he train in the perfection of wisdom?üîΩ The Lord: Subhuti, a Bodhisattva, a great being, who wants to train in the perfection of wisdom should thus train: I shall fully know the supreme enlightenment.

original: sgom pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //üîΩ'ga' zhig tu ni nye bar rtog pa dang nges par bsam pa'o zhes bya ba 'don pa ste /üîΩde la sgom pa'o zhes bya bas zhi gnas smras pa nye bar rtog pa ni lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: sgom pa'o zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o // 'ga' zhig tu ni nye bar rtog pa dang nges par bsam pa'o zhes bya ba 'don pa ste / de la sgom pa'o zhes bya bas zhi gnas smras pa nye bar rtog pa ni lhag mthong ngo //
translated: The Lord: A Bodhisattva, a great being, who wants to train in the perfection of wisdom should thus train: I shall fully know form, etc. to: all-knowledge.üîΩ Subhuti: How, O Lord, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, train in the perfection of wisdom?üîΩ The Lord: A Bodhisattva, a great being, who wants to train in the perfection of wisdom should thus train: I shall fully know form, etc. to: all-knowledge.üîΩ Subhuti: How, O Lord, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: nges par sems pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag go //
analyzed: nges par sems pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag go //
translated: The Lord: A Bodhisattva, a great being, who wants to train in the perfection of wisdom should thus train: I shall fully know form, etc. to: all-knowledge.üîΩ Subhuti: How, O Lord, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid la byed pa nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid la byed pa nye bar bstan nas /
translated: The Lord: A Bodhisattva, a great being, who wants to train in the perfection of wisdom should thus train: I shall fully know form, etc. to: all-knowledge.üîΩ Subhuti: How, O Lord, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: de'i 'bras bu rgyas par bshad par 'dod cing dogs par byed de /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu rgyas par bshad par 'dod cing dogs par byed de /
translated: The Lord: A Bodhisattva, a great being, who wants to train in the perfection of wisdom should thus train: I shall fully know form, etc. to: all-knowledge.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Subhuti: How, O Lord, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, train in the perfection of wisdom?üîΩ The Lord: A Bodhisattva, a great being, who wants to train in the perfection of wisdom should thus train: I shall fully know form, etc. to: all-knowledge.üîΩ Subhuti: How,

original: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid la byed pa dogs pa gang gis so //
analyzed: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i yid la byed pa dogs pa gang gis so //
translated: That is the non-conceptual mental attention which is free from doubt.

original: chos 'di dag ces bya ba ni chos rnams thams cad do //
analyzed: chos 'di dag ces bya ba ni chos rnams thams cad do //
translated: These phenomena are all phenomena.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par phyogs par byas pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par phyogs par byas pa'o //
translated: They are directed towards the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs nye bar mi rtogs zhes bya ba ni snga rol du ming gis mi rtogs so //üîΩgzugs nye bar mi 'dzin zhes @53a * //
analyzed: gzugs nye bar mi rtogs zhes bya ba ni snga rol du ming gis mi rtogs so // gzugs nye bar mi 'dzin zhes @53a * //
translated: Form is not apprehended means that previously it is not apprehended by name.

original: bya ba ni de nas yid kyis 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba ni de nas yid kyis 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Form is not grasped means that subsequently it is not grasped by mind.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar zhes rtog pa la gtan tshigs nyid snying po can du gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar zhes rtog pa la gtan tshigs nyid snying po can du gsungs pa /
translated: Why is it so? The reason is stated in the essence of the question:

original: gzugs skye bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs skye bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because form is not seen arising, etc.

original: gang gi phyir kun brtags kyi gzugs la skye ba dang 'gag pa dag mi mthong ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun brtags kyi gzugs la skye ba dang 'gag pa dag mi mthong ste /
translated: Because the imagined form is not seen to arise or cease,

original: de bas na de mi rtogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na de mi rtogs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: therefore it is not apprehended. This is the meaning.

original: gzugs kyi skye ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ni gzugs ma lags pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye ba ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ni gzugs ma lags pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That non-arising of form is not form.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo ni skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin te de'i phyir skye ba med pa la kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rang bzhin ma yin pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo ni skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin te de'i phyir skye ba med pa la kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid rang bzhin ma yin pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The perfected nature is the unborn nature, and therefore the non-arisen is said to be the nature of the imagined characteristic.üîΩThe non-destruction of form is not form.

original: gzugs kyi 'jig pa ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ni gzugs ma lags te zhes bya ba ni med pa'i ngo bo la kun brtags pa'i rnam pa 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'jig pa ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ni gzugs ma lags te zhes bya ba ni med pa'i ngo bo la kun brtags pa'i rnam pa 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The imagined aspect of non-existence is destruction.

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called destruction.

original: gang yang kun brtags kyi gzugs la brtags pa'i 'jig pa de ni chos nyid kyi gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang kun brtags kyi gzugs la brtags pa'i 'jig pa de ni chos nyid kyi gzugs ma yin no //
translated: The destruction imagined in imagined form is not the form of reality.

original: mi 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la 'jig pa ni 'jig pa ste de med pas na mi 'jig pa ste yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i 'don pa la 'jig pa ni 'jig pa ste de med pas na mi 'jig pa ste yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The recitation of ‚Äúnon-destruction‚Äù is destruction, and because it does not exist, it is non-destruction, the perfected nature.

original: de la kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid med pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid med pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The non-existence of the imagined characteristic is stated in that.

original: des na skye ba ma mchis pa dang gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis shing gnyis su bgyir ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir skye ba med pa la yang chos nyid kyi
analyzed: des na skye ba ma mchis pa dang gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis shing gnyis su bgyir ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la skye ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir skye ba med pa la yang chos nyid kyi
translated: Therefore, non-arising and what is called form are not dual and cannot be made dual.üîΩThis means that because the reality of form is by nature non-arising, non-arising is the reality of form.

original: rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba dang skye ba med ces bya ba gcig pa kho na ste so sor ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gzugs zhes bya ba dang skye ba med ces bya ba gcig pa kho na ste so sor ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, what is called form and non-arising are the same, not separate.
